text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today we are going to be making something
that we have never made

before, this is gonna be a first. We are gonna
be making a cake that is

going to be in an app game. And not just any app
game!

It’s gonna be in a game I have been playing
for about 3 years.

It was about 2 years ago I uploaded my very first
what’s on my iPhone video,

and one of the games that I was playing was
Dragonvale!

I love this game, it is adorable, for those
of you who aren’t familiar

with it, it’s like a Dragon collection
game.

You have a little wizard park, and there’s
different little habitats

where you collect your dragons, breed dragons,
and wizards pay a little
money to see them.

I’ve gone a little crazy with it, I’ve
gotten almost every dragon you

can collect, and one of the reasons I really
like this game is because
they're always coming out with really cute, new dragons.

They start off as little baby dragons, and
as you feed them treats,
they grow up and evolve, and they’re adorable!

Sometimes they do holiday events, like the
one right over here.
These are some that I got for easter!

And one of their newest is the legendary dragon
Gaia, she’s right here,
and she helps you hatch your eggs instantly.

It’s really cool, I think you can do this
about every 3 days.

If you click on her you’ll see these are
all the eggs that are

in incubation, so instead of waiting, you
can pick one of them to hatch…
(snaps)
Like that!

Today we are gonna be making a treat that
you will be able to find in the
game, let me show you!

I’m gonna click on one of these little treat
farms.

There’s lots of different little veggies
and fruits that are all made up.

They have some cute ones, they have Dragon
Snaps, Dragon Root,

Pumpermelons which are like pumpkin melons,
Dragonfruit, so today,

we are going to design and make a Dragonvale
treat that is going to be

in the game! It’s going to be in the actual
game you guys, this is so exciting!
Alright, let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 3 cups
of all purpose flour,

1-1/4 cup sugar, 1-1/4 cup of whole milk,
4 eggs, 2 sticks of butter

at room temperature, some crispy cereal treats,
1 tablespoon of baking

powder, 1/2 a teaspoon of salt, 1/2 a teaspoon
of almond extract,
and, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.

You will also need 1 dragonfruit, and, it
looks so cool, I found it at

the local market, it kind of looks like a
dragon egg, I’ve never made

something with dragonfruit before, this is
a first!
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is puree
our dragonfruit.

I was just gonna place my dragonfruit on top
of a cutting mat, cut
straight down. Oh you guys, this is so cool!
This is so pretty!

Take a little spoon, scoop out the meat, and
place it in the blender!

Since I know there’s plenty, I’m just
gonna have a little bite for me!

It kind of reminds me, if a Kiwi met a pear,
and had a baby!
A Kiwi-Pear!
And, we’re gonna mix it up in our blender!

Now we’re gonna take our dragonfruit puree
and we’re gonna measure out

a cup and 1/4 of it. Then we’re gonna add
our milk, to our dragonfruit

puree. Next we are gonna sift together our
flour, salt, and baking powder

into a big bowl. I’m gonna start with my
flour.

I make it rain! I make it rain! I make it
rain!
Now our salt, and our baking powder, shake-shake-shake!

Time to cream together our butter and sugar
into this big mixing bowl.
We’re gonna pour in all of our sugar, and our butter,

remember, you’ll want it to be at
room temperature.

Then we’re gonna take our mixer and mix
together until it’s light

and fluffy! And now we’re gonna add some
of our wet ingredients to this

smaller bowl, and mix ‘em together before
we add them to the butter mixture.

We’re gonna be adding all of our eggs into
here, then add your extracts,
we’re gonna add the vanilla, and almond.

Using a spatula, I’m just gonna gently mix
together.

Then we are going to slowly add our wet mixture
to our butter mixture,
while mixing!

Now we have all of our mixtures! We’ve got
our dry mixture, our wet
butter mixture, and our dragonfruit milk mixture.

We’re gonna alternate adding our flour and
dragonfruit milk to our
butter, starting and ending with flour.

Our batter is ready, over here I have lined
and greased 3-8 inch round

cake pans, with a little piece of parchment
paper at the bottom.

And, I’m just gonna eyeball it, and pour
our batter into these 3 pans!

Once you’ve poured your batter into all
of your pans you’re just gonna
give them a little shake. Shake-shake-shake!
Shake-shake-shake!
Shake-shake-shake!

Now we’re gonna pop them in the oven at
350 degrees and bake them for
about 30-40 minutes.

Once your cakes have baked and had plenty
of time to cool.

I just leveled them off with a cake leveler,
so they’re all about
the same height.

Over here I’ve got a little turntable, and
a cake stand on the top.

So, I’m gonna take a little bit of frosting,
I’ve got some buttercream,

and, I’ve dyed it orange. I put it into
a plastic baggie and I cut off

the tip. I’m just gonna put a little bit,
boop!

Then you’re gonna take your first cake layer,
transfer it over to your

cake stand, and now frost in-between each
layer.
Take a spatula, smooth it out!
Is that flat?
Yeah, that’s pretty good!

Now goes our second layer, we’re gonna put
a little frosting in-between,
and smooth it out. Then add our final layer.

Our cake is assembled and now we are gonna
frost the cake with

a crumb-coat layer. It’s just a very thin
layer where crumbs are showing,

that’s OK, because, we are gonna decorate
soon after!

This is the first time on Nerdy Nummies that
we have ever made an

ombre cake. And we’re doing this because
in the game Dragonvale,

the dragonfruits in that game are an ombre
color.

An ombre is a gradient of different colors
and over here we are gonna
be using pink, orange, and yellow!

This is just buttercream frosting that we’ve
put into a plastic baggie

and I’ve just cut off the end, I don’t
have a tip.

We’re gonna start at the bottom of our cake,
and we’re just gonna pipe a layer
at the very bottom.

After you’ve got the pink frosting all the
way around the bottom of the

cake, we’re gonna take a spatula and flatten
it out.

Take your next color, I’m gonna be using
orange, and I’m just gonna be

applying it right on top of the pink and all
the way up to the top
of the cake.

Now we’re gonna smooth it out, take your
spatula and just go back and forth!

Last frosting, is our yellow buttercream frosting,
I’m gonna apply a

thin layer on the top. We’ve got our 3 layers
frosted, now I’m gonna take

an icing smoother, and hold it parallel to
the cake
and go all the way around!

Last step for frosting is we’re gonna smooth
out the top. You just take
a little spatula, and put it on the outside and then you're just

gonna pull in. Wipe off the excess frosting
and work your way all
the way around the top.

Our cake is frosted! And now it’s time for
my favorite part!
It’s time to decorate!

Over here I have rolled out some green fondant
and we are gonna be making
a whole bunch of leaves!

We have 2 football cookie cutters, one is
a 4-1/2 inch and one is a 4 inch.
We’re just gonna cut out a bunch of leaves.

We also have a small teardrop cookie cutter,
we’re gonna need to cut out

8 of these. With our big leaves, I’m gonna
take a sharp cutting
knife and I’m just gonna cut these in half.

I made a bunch of leaves, and now I’m just
using this little fondant
tool, to make some veins.

Just apply a little bit of pressure, and make
some marks on the side.

Time to assemble our cake, we are going to
add all of our decoration

details, we’re gonna add 2 medium leaves
first, at the bottom.

Then space them out, just a little bit. You’re
gonna go all the way

around the cake. Then you’re gonna take
your larger leaf, and you’re
gonna place it in the middle!

We’ve got our leaves all the way around
the bottom of our cake.

And over here I’ve got buttercream frosting,
which I’ve dyed a light

green with a number 12 tip at the top, and
I’m gonna make little dots

all the way around the cake on top of the
leaves to create a nice border.

Now we’re gonna decorate by making a top
border. I’ve got the same light

green frosting in this baggie, but, with a
2A tip. And we’re gonna be

making dots, right on the top. Now we’re
gonna take our small leaves and

we’re gonna place them evenly around the
top of the cake.

Once your frosting starts to set a little
bit, you can take your finger,

and just boop-boop-boop! Tap down the peaks
of the frosting!

Our cake is coming together, now we are gonna
make a cake topper!

We are gonna take our crispy cereal treats,
and we are gonna mold

them into kind of like a mango shape, to look
like the dragon fruit

from the game. So, just using your hands,
I’m just gonna roll it.

After you’ve shaped your rice krispies,
now I’m gonna roll it in a

little bit of fondant. You’re just gonna
cover the whole thing.

This isn’t very glamorous, I just give it
a twist, remove the

excess fondant and then you’re just gonna
keep molding it, into
kind of a mango shape.

Then we’re gonna add a second layer of fondant
so that you won’t see all
the lumps from the crispy treat.
Time for a little edible arts and crafts!

We’ve got our little crispy mango over here,
and then here in my

plastic palate, I’ve got red, pink, orange,
and a little bit of yellow

food coloring dye. Over here I’ve got a
little bit of orange extract,

you want something with alcohol in it, to
have it stick to the fondant.

So I’m gonna start with red, just take a
little dabble, boop-boop!

And I’m gonna start at the bottom, and we’re
just gonna fade it up.

Start with red, move to pink, then orange,
then yellow!
And give our little dragonfruit an ombre look!

Final step, I’ve got a little bit of yellow
buttercream frosting, I’m

just gonna put a little bit right here, boop,
boop, boop!

Then, we’re gonna take, our little dragonfruit,
I’m gonna place him right

in the middle. For an extra detail, just for
fun, I made a baby

fire dragon out of fondant. Oooh! Look at
him!

This is one of the first dragons that you
get when you’re playing the game,

there’s the fire dragon, the earth dragon,
the water dragon.

This is what he looks like when he’s a baby,
I’m gonna stick him right

here on the front of the cake, just hanging
out, because he’s so cute!

This is what he looks like when he grows up
in the game.
I named mine Hot Pocket.
Eh-herm-herm-herm-herm-herm!
Ta-da!

Here is the Dragonfruit Cake that we made
today!
We designed this to be in the video game Dragonvale!

I am super excited! A big thanks to Dragonvale
for sponsoring the video.

I’ll be taking lots of pictures and posting
them on Facebook, Twitter,

Instagram and Tumblr! And if you guys make
this cake, please take a

picture and send it to me. I love seeing your
baking creations!
It just makes me happy! It makes my day!

Also, I’ll be putting the link down below
where you can download and
play Dragonvale for free!
And check out, huh, our cake!

If you guys spot our cake, please take a screen
cap and like, tweet it
to me or Instagram it to me, I’m so excited!
Awh!

If you guys have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please

let me know, leave me a comment down below
and I will do my best
to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
